'''''Tolkien: A Mythology for England?''''' is a collection of the proceedings of the 13th Tolkien Society Seminar held in Cambridge in 1999. The book was published by [[The Tolkien Society]] in [[2000]] under the auspices of the [[Peter Roe Memorial Fund]].

==Contents==

*"The Romans in Middle-earth: Classical Precedents for Tolkien's Early Conception of Mythology" by Allan Turner
*"Monsters, Maldon and Holy Maidenhood: Tolkien's Real Mythology for England" by Andrew Wells
*"Reflections on Reflections on Fairy Stories" by Gwydion M. Williams
*"England? Which England?: Concepts Of Englishness 1982-1954" by [[David Doughan]]
*"Some English Myth-Makers: Success and Failure Prior to Tolkien" by Christine Davidson
*"Tolkien's Mythology of England: The Shire as 'Local Community'" by [[John Ellison]]
